page.title: 17Conflicts in Leighfield
page.content: The area was originally crossed by several footpaths and bridleways but in creating large arable fields these have in several places been ploughed up and not reinstated. Most notable of these is the bridleway which runs from Launde Park Wood to Leigh Lodge Farm and the footpath from Leigh Lodge Farm to Frog Hall has also been ploughed up. Much controversy exists regarding the removal of such ancient rights of way as well as the rerouting of others by farmers for their own convenience. Potential conflicts of interest between hunting and shooting are avoided by mutual agreement of hunting and shooting dates so that clashes do not occur. The type of hunting country has been altered by the replacement of grass fields and hedges by arable fields with few natural boundaries, to the detriment of the sport.
